channel.title: Feelin' like shit
channel.description:
Hi mopar...
So for the past week or so, I've pretty much, in an overall statement, felt like shit. I really haven't been giving a fuck to anything, and I've been highly cynical about a lot of things. I've never really felt like it, and I feel it's a little to much to say I'm depressed. I just find that I come home from school, eat dinner, do my homework, then I'll maybe play guitar for an hour or two making up riffs that I forget by the next day. I've pretty much stopped caring about games like runescape or minecraft, and while battlefield might be fun for an hour, I'll just get off. My only goal is to live for the weekend where I can have some margin of a good time, but lately I really haven't been hanging out with friends as much.
I've been doing shit on stuff like tests, and I barely pay attention in class (for another reason too, but still). When I just have time to talk in class I guess stuff is ok, but when I come home I just fucking hate everything. Life just seems really slow and boring, and I just wanna live life to it's fullest before I drive myself into a pit of depression. Does anyone have any ideas of what I can do to get out of my shithole?

item.title: Feelin' like shit
item.dc:creator: @Cres Cres
item.description:
@Cres wrote:

I know what I’m gonna do when school stops…
Learn scripting languages and make websites , I can also work at like banking services because they seem to use ALOT of Java in their applets , I really like to program and that’s what I’m gonna do later on in my life.

I suggest you do something you like too , in a way it can actually produce somthing to you like money or knowledge.

Read full topic

item.title: Feelin' like shit
item.dc:creator: @Andrew_Ferguson The317Guy
item.description:
@Andrew_Ferguson wrote:

Welcome to adult hood, where you realize life is shitty.

But really, try and find something that interests you to take your mind of things, helped me get through some times.

Read full topic

item.title: Feelin' like shit
item.dc:creator: @reyx7 reyx7
item.description:
@reyx7 wrote:

Applied for a job. The only free hours they have is weekends 1pm-7pm, but that leaves my night open. Appearently my hours can get changed to weekdays after a few weeks.

item.title: Feelin' like shit
item.dc:creator: @TheCyberMan TheCyberMan
item.description:
@TheCyberMan wrote:

[quote=“Cres, post:24, topic:416091”][quote author=rip4d link=topic=518029.msg3763834#msg3763834 date=1317078089]
A lucid dream is when you realize that you’re dreaming and you can control what happens in it. Plus when you realize you’re dreaming, you become so aware so quickly. The dream suddenly becomes vibrant. Its truly amazing Just don’t be disappointed if you try something then fail though, in your first few lucid dreams, you’re still not used to the fact you’re actually in a dream and can do incredible things. You’re kinda restricted in the first 3 or 4 Still, its awesome <3 (Then again, the things I try doing are like, JRPG related things )
[/quote]

I once dream I was on the toilet so I peed and when I woke up my bed was soaked![/quote]I once fell asleep and woke up on the toilet O.O

Anyway, I recommend something to keep you occupied and looking forward to the future–in a good way. Like hanging out with friends/girlfriend, joining a club, being actively religious, etc.

Read full topic

Girls make everything better, at least she did for me.

item.title: Feelin' like shit
item.dc:creator: @NewbieNewty Newty
item.description:
@NewbieNewty wrote:

Sorry to be a cynic here but I would say that what you have is close to depression. I live pretty much the same way… When I’m alert and doing things; working, hanging with friends, etc I don’t notice it. But just like you the minute I get home this darkness just jumps on me and I feel awful and all I want to do is sleep to make it stop. Then I have to wake up and repeat it every day… I’m hoping once I get out of this shitty job and back to college that ill return to normal

Read full topic

item.title: Feelin' like shit
item.dc:creator: @Pure_Slay Pure Slay
item.description:
@Pure_Slay wrote:

Get a job. After you spend the majority of the time hating your job, you’ll have barely any time to complain about how much the real world sucks, and how you wish you could of never grown up.

Read full topic

item.title: Feelin' like shit
item.dc:creator: @xryz xryz
item.description:
@xryz wrote:

[quote=“Fridder, post:8, topic:416091”]I don’t give a shit about school either, and somehow my grades are all 85+.
Last year, I didn’t do shit. I didn’t do homework, projects, … anything. I just sat my ass down and slept through most of the classes, and I passed with an 87. Must have been the quizzes/tests/classwork that I half-assed.

When your sick of feeling like shit, work out, take a shower, do your homework (optional) then sleep for a while. Or stay on mopar until 1am then attempt to do your homework but end up getting nothing done and continue looking on mopar.[/quote]

thats how i was through high school.

[quote=“CoonHunter, post:20, topic:416091”]To be honest, my day mood goes about the same.

I get up and go to work. When I’m done, I generally come home and sit in my room and just watch a movie, while pirating another. For example, I have 2 movies downloading as I type. The way I actually had this issue solved was me buying my street bike. The issue with this would be convincing your parents to let you get one. It took me 2 months to break my dad (asking daily, comming up with reasons every day, etc) while my mom said as long as I drive safe she doesn’t care. When people come to me with real problems like depression, or severe boredom leading to depression I actually suggest this.

Both of these are myn, while the street bike used to get far more attention, the clutch cable recently broke and a new one is getting harder to find. I bought my first motorcycle around 2 months after my aunt was killed. Riding a motorcycle is a great time to be able to clear your mind and only concentrate on the moment at hand. When going 60 on a cruiser or evern 130+ (i hit 146 so far) on a street bike (although not recommended for beginners) its just you and the moment. Nothing to hold you back, nothing to get in your way. Keep in mind that is a figure of speach. Things can hold you back, and stuff can get in your way. Anyways, if you decide on anything. I would suggest a Kawasaki ninja 250cc for a first bike. They are the most recommended bikes for beginners as they are small, and not speed demons.
http://www.kawasaki.com/Products/product-specifications.aspx?id=505[/quote]

i was thinking about getting a ninja 250 when i get my motorcycle license, a job save up for one.

OT: I was feeling like that for a long time and recently. my routine was similar. I think i was depressed b/c of my previous relationship. I’ve gotten way better having a girl at my college say hi to me daily has helped in the past couple months. that doesnt really apply to ur situation i dont think. but b4 that i was trying to find things to spark my interest and keep my mind off things that were making me feel that way. b4 my previous relationship i was feeling just like you(just b/c of the routine and line in general) and when my ex and i first got together everything seemed to be fixed but after we were over the feeling like shit was just amplified. Hope you find someway to stop feeling that way it sucks and ive been trying to start feeling better.

Read full topic

The way I actually had this issue solved was me buying my street bike. The issue with this would be convincing your parents to let you get one. Both of these are myn, while the street bike used to get far more attention, the clutch cable recently broke and a new one is getting harder to find. I bought my first motorcycle around 2 months after my aunt was killed. Riding a motorcycle is a great time to be able to clear your mind and only concentrate on the moment at hand. When going 60 on a cruiser or evern 130+ (i hit 146 so far) on a street bike (although not recommended for beginners) its just you and the moment. item.dc:creator: @drubrkletern drubrkletern

A lucid dream is when you realize that you’re dreaming and you can control what happens in it. Plus when you realize you’re dreaming, you become so aware so quickly. The dream suddenly becomes vibrant. Its truly amazing Just don’t be disappointed if you try something then fail though, in your first few lucid dreams, you’re still not used to the fact you’re actually in a dream and can do incredible things. You’re kinda restricted in the first 3 or 4 Still, its awesome <3 (Then again, the things I try doing are like, JRPG related things )

I wish i can do that… I’ve only realized ive been dreaming once… the rest of the times its usually something that haunts me… been too scared in most of ma dreams to realize and look around and notice its a dream… too busy running away from whatever the fuck it is from something that wants to rape my head or slit my throat…

OT
Um… dunno… I just look for w/e i can and pass the time, works for me

item.title: Feelin' like shit
item.dc:creator: @imsuperman05 imsuperman05
item.description:
@imsuperman05 wrote:

If you’re really depressed, and thinking of suicide tell somebody. Don’t give up on school though. School is the most important aspect of your teenager life. Don’t fuck up just because of some bullshit. This happened to me… I was depressed for a while, and fucked up in school, and it’s biting me in the ass today… I’m a senior with a 2.4 GPA. And SAT score atm is like 800…

Whatever the reason you’re depressed for, you’ll get over it. Just focus on school, nothing else.

Read full topic
